column5: Went out to Mountsberg Sunday from 12noon to 2:30pm in the kayak for my last pike outing of the year. Did an hour long drift across the lake in 10-15km/h breeze. Picked up 5 pike on drift and two fishing the bay out of the wind. All were caught on Blue Fox spinner #4 in firetiger. This one was the last of the 7 fish and was 28" long. Sadly, the biggest of three trips for pike.  Of course the wind picked up to 20-25km/h for my paddle back across the lake. If I catch any more pike it will be accidental as I'll now target crappies next week and then Musky opener the following weekend. Add a walleye trip or two and the next thing you know, Bass will be open.
Nice pike! It looks like a storm's rolling in or something ... the sky's so dark for that time of the day.
Thanks jedi, that's a great picture & I always enjoy reading about your "yak" adventures  Good luck with the upcoming musky season.
Thanks lew. I think it's my camera Victor, it's just a cheap kodak, here is the first pic that I took without a flash. Turned out very dark, but the fish still looks good.
That's a nice pike in anyone's book.
nice looking pike, thanks for sharing.
Thats a respectable looking pike. Good luck on the Musky's.
Sounds like a fun paddle back up the lake Jedi .  Nice pike there tough and looking forward to hearing about muskies dragging you all over the place.

Hey Bro nice job on the pond. Inspector Gadget and I are heading there on Thurs morn for some action, got something new I wanna try, will let u in on the secret if it pays off well. Can't wait for Ski opener. Might get out for some Craps too soon, good luck when ya go.

Thanks all. No SS, no salmon fishing until I can cast for them in the fall from the pier. Looking forward to your report on Thursday Joonmoon. Make sure the Gadget gets at least one OK? The weeds are definately on the rise now. Had most of my luck near where we were last time in the dead heads. Good luck Bro.
